meanings.definition: Having or showing courage or determination.
meanings.sent1: He made a manful attempt to rescue the kitten from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's manful bravery inspired his comrades.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, the puppy made a manful effort to protect its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her manful decision to speak up against injustice was commendable.
meanings.sent5: The manful firefighter charged into the burning building to save the trapped family.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or befitting a man.
meanings.sent1: His manful stature and deep voice commanded attention in the room.
meanings.sent2: The manful handshake he offered showed his respect and strength.
meanings.sent3: The manful beard he grew made him look quite distinguished.
meanings.sent4: Her manful stride and confident posture caught everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The manful way he handled the situation demonstrated his leadership qualities.

meanings.sent1: He faced the challenge manful, without any hint of fear.
meanings.sent2: The knight rode manful into battle, ready to defend his kingdom.
meanings.sent3: She laughed manful at his silly joke, enjoying the light-hearted moment.
meanings.sent4: The athlete ran manful towards the finish line, determined to win the race.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor still sang manful as he worked, his voice echoing across the harbor.
